s.text: The explicit adoption of such a strategy, subversive as it may seem of both the democratic process and deficit reduction, may strike Republicans as irresponsible.
The explicit adoption of such a strategy, subversive as it may seem of both the democratic process and deficit reduction, may strike Republicans as irresponsible.
The explicit adoption of such a strategy, subversive as it may seem of both the democratic process and deficit reduction, may strike Republicans as irresponsible.
The explicit adoption of such a strategy, subversive as it may seem of both the democratic process and deficit reduction, may strike Republicans as irresponsible.
The explicit adoption of such a strategy, subversive as it may seem of both the democratic process and deficit reduction, may strike Republicans as irresponsible.
If the last few elections have shown anything, it is that voters don't like cuts; if the deficit evaporates, the demand for cuts--and reforms--evaporates with it.
CPI overestimation also serves another GOP interest: cutting federal programs.

Already, most Americans never pay an income-tax rate higher than 15 percent (the 1995 median household income was $34,076--a married couple would have to make more than $40,100 to hit the next tax bracket).
